div.div:
Too balanced
too perfect
too idyllic
No children

div.div:
No language
Still primordial
essentially telepathic
(try with a wolf you raise)

div.div:
Remove X chromosome,
replace it with a Y to make
male!

div.div:
Angels
can only transmit,
not receive

div.div:
Angels, continue to transmit
only some (humans) can hear/see/smell them

div.div:
Perhaps intimacy with men
was expressed by teaching/
providing them with the tools
necessary to build our societies

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 410px; margin-left: 510px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
Asymmetry
Adam & Eve sin
banished from
the garden

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 217px; height: 1px; padding-top: 668px; margin-left: 583px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;

div.span: I wonder why we our heritage is then

switch.text: I wonder why we our heritage is then...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 623px; margin-left: 723px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 287px; height: 1px; padding-top: 870px; margin-left: 415px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.span: But this seems to be backwards. If one thinks of the creation of Mankind in terms of genes, why would the first human created have X and a Y chromosomes. Would not it make sense to first create the human with only X chromosomes, and then to fashion a being in which you had replaced one of the X chromosomes with a Y? Would that not be an evolutionary step, rather than the other one, which would replace an original Y chromosome with an X?

switch.text: But this seems to be backwards. If one thinks of...

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
